qas.question: What are the average temperatures for summer?
What was the average temperature for July 2011?

context: Paris has a typical Western European oceanic climate (Köppen climate classification: Cfb ) which is affected by the <a0_0>North Atlantic Current<a0_0/>. The overall climate throughout the year is <a1_0>mild and moderately wet<a1_0/>. Summer days are usually warm and pleasant with average temperatures hovering <a2_0>between 15 and 25 °C<a2_0/> (59 and 77 °F), and a fair amount of sunshine. Each year, however, there are a few days where the temperature rises above 32 °C (90 °F). Some years have even witnessed long periods of harsh summer weather, such as the heat wave of 2003 when temperatures exceeded 30 °C (86 °F) for weeks, surged up to 40 °C (104 °F) on some days and seldom cooled down at night. More recently, the average temperature for July 2011 was <a3_0>17.6 °C<a3_0/> (63.7 °F), with an average minimum temperature of 12.9 °C (55.2 °F) and an average maximum temperature of 23.7 °C (74.7 °F).
